LanguageData.BrickHempcrete.description: Refined, carefully-cut stone tiles for a castle feeling. Pretty to look at, but they take a long time to lay.
LanguageData.BrickHempcrete.label: hempcrete bricks
LanguageData.FlagstoneHempcrete.description: Roughly-cut stone tiles. Not super pretty, but they make good surfaces for roads and outdoor walkways. Deconstructing flagstone yields no resources.
LanguageData.FlagstoneHempcrete.label: hempcrete flagstone
LanguageData.Hempcrete.label: hempcrete
LanguageData.Hempcrete.description: Smooth hempcrete floor. Fast to walk on, easy to clean.
LanguageData.HempcreteTile.label: hempcrete tile
LanguageData.HempcreteTile.description: Large hempcrete tiles. Pretty, but labor and material-intensive.
LanguageData.HempcretePlate.label: hempcrete plate
LanguageData.HempcretePlate.description: Large hempcrete tiles. Pretty, but labor and material-intensive.
LanguageData.HempcretePath.label: hempcrete path
LanguageData.HempcretePath.description: A random looking path made from smooth hempcrete chunks.
LanguageData.CarpetHemp.label: hemp carpet
LanguageData.CarpetHemp.description: Durable carpet woven from hemp fibers. It is slightly flame resistant.
LanguageData.CarpetDevilsleaf.label: devilsleaf carpet
LanguageData.CarpetDevilsleaf.description: Carpet woven from devilsleaf fibers. It is slightly flame resistant.
LanguageData.HempStalkFloor.label: hemp stalk floor
LanguageData.HempStalkFloor.description: Boards made from the stalks of smokeleaf make for a beautiful floor. Be careful for fires.
